title: ITV2’s Killer Camp dubbed ‘murder’ Love Island and we’re already hooked
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

ITV2’s brand new reality series Killer Camp kicked off last night and fans are hailing it the new ‘murder’ Love Island.

The scary competition show airs across five nights during the lead up to Halloween and the first episode saw 11 unsuspecting contributors dropped into an 80s inspired lake lodge where they were told that there was a secret killer amongst them.

Tasked with earning cash whilst avoiding being left in a bodybag and therefore eliminated, the contestants are also challenged with figuring out the attacker before it’s too late.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Yep, it’s like our fave slasher movie meets Hunted with a load of Love Island wannabes thrown in for good measure aka our dream show.

Unsurprisingly, the series has already got audiences hooked with one writing on Twitter: ‘Guys. KILLER CAMP on ITV2. It’s like murder Love Island. I am so completely sold.’

Viewers are already obsessed with Killer Camp

Guys. KILLER CAMP on itv. It’s like murder love island. I am so completely sold. — Ava Eldred (@ava_eldred) October 27, 2019

#KillerCamp im already loving it!!

Me and nan 100% think its Jacques but idk, there might be ANOTHER plot twist 🤷🏽‍♀️ — Payton (@PaytonJaques) October 27, 2019

#KillerCamp is Hilarious. It’s like Cluedo meets Big Brother. When instead of the housemates being evicted they are killed. It’s on #ITV2 check it out — Jamie (@Jamie39556758) October 27, 2019

It's a bit like I'm A Celeb mixed w Release The Hounds, in a way?? But either way it ain't half bad #KillerCamp — Inksie Gatsby (mostly fandom things) (@deputy_kaspbrak) October 27, 2019

Well @itv2 may well have struck gold with #killercamp. What a great idea! And to kill off a camper within the first 5 minutes was perfect. A couple more seasons with a growing budget and this show will be epic! #whodunnit #iwannaplay — lisa cooper (@lisac00ps) October 27, 2019

So #KillerCamp is my new favourite tv show… if you love horror then this is up your street! Homage to the 80s slasher movies meets love island wannabes! Can’t wait for episode 2 @KillerCampTV — John Naples-Campbell (@JNaplesCampbell) October 27, 2019

Killer Camp is airing now (Picture: ITV)

Echoing a similiar sentiment, another added: ‘So #KillerCamp is my new favourite tv show… if you love horror then this is up your street!

‘Homage to the 80s slasher movies meets love island wannabes! Can’t wait for episode 2.’

The new series will distract you from the Love Island shaped hole in your heart (Picture: ITV)

Comedian Bobby Mair presents Killer Camp and has taken on the role of Camp Counsellor.

‘Being a presenter, Camp Counsellor and facilitator of murder is the job I was born to do!’ he enthused ahead of the first episode.

‘I really hope ITV2 viewers have as much fun watching this show as much as I had getting to make it.’

Judging from the trailer for tonight’s upcoming episode, doubt kicks in and the contestants begin to start pointing fingers at who could be the killer.

On top of that, relationships start to blossom as one cheeky chappy admits his feelings for a fellow competitor.

Killer Camp continues tonight at 9pm on ITV2 Love Island returns in January 2020.
